title: BIODEGRADABLE EXCIPIENT SYSTEMS FOR THERAPEUTICALLY ACTIVE SUBSTANCES AND METHOD FOR PRODUCING THE SAME
abstract: The invention relates to a formulation for a sustained-release biodegradable medicament that contains an excipient system. Said excipient system consists of biodegradable blood plasma products that have been dried in a fluidized bed while maintaining their properties and an active substance to be applied as a sustained-release substance or a combination of active substances.

motivations: There is a need for biodegradable excipient systems that can effectively deliver therapeutically active substances in a sustained-release manner.
objectives: Develop a biodegradable excipient system for sustained-release medicaments using blood plasma products.
methods: Utilize a fluidized bed drying process to preserve the properties of biodegradable blood plasma products.
results: Create a formulation for sustained-release biodegradable medicaments that can effectively deliver therapeutically active substances.

motivations: There is a need for a formulation for a sustained-release biodegradable medicament that contains an excipient system.
The current methods of producing such formulations may not maintain the properties of biodegradable blood plasma products.
objectives: Develop a formulation for a sustained-release biodegradable medicament that contains an excipient system.
Ensure the excipient system consists of biodegradable blood plasma products that maintain their properties after being dried in a fluidized bed.
methods: Use biodegradable blood plasma products as the excipient system in the formulation.
Dry the biodegradable blood plasma products in a fluidized bed to maintain their properties.
Include an active substance or a combination of active substances to be applied as a sustained-release substance in the formulation.
results: Produce a formulation for a sustained-release biodegradable medicament that contains an excipient system.
Ensure the excipient system maintains the properties of biodegradable blood plasma products after being dried in a fluidized bed.
openai_json.research_subject: Biodegradable excipient systems for therapeutically active substances

motivations: There is a need for sustained-release drug delivery systems that can provide controlled release of therapeutic substances over extended periods.
Current excipient systems may lack biodegradability and biocompatibility, limiting their safety and environmental sustainability.
objectives: Develop a biodegradable excipient system using blood plasma products for sustained-release drug delivery.
Create a formulation that maintains the properties of biodegradable materials while enabling controlled release of active substances.
methods: Utilize fluidized bed drying technology to process biodegradable blood plasma products while preserving their properties.
Combine dried blood plasma products with therapeutic active substances to create sustained-release formulations.
results: A biodegradable excipient system that enables sustained release of therapeutic substances.
Improved biocompatibility and environmental sustainability compared to conventional excipient systems.
